content:
I remember! You mentioned that earlier. Packing 5 shirts for a 5-day trip to Paris might have been a bit excessive, but it's great that you learned from that experience and are planning to pack more thoughtfully for this trip to Japan.

Packing light is an art, and it takes some practice to get it right. But with a little planning and consideration, you can pack just what you need and avoid overpacking.

For this trip, you might consider packing 2-3 shirts that can be mixed and matched with different bottoms and layers to create multiple outfits. Don't forget to choose items that are versatile, comfortable, and suitable for the season and activities you have planned.

Remember, it's always better to err on the side of caution and pack a little less, rather than overpacking and lugging around a heavy suitcase. And if you find that you need something, you can always purchase it when you arrive at your destination or do a quick laundry.

You got this!
